title: Principles of Growth Investing
text: Thinking about buying a growth stock? Here's a checklist that you can use to greatly increase your odds of success.

title: Israeli cybersecurity company Tufin prices IPO at $14 a share
text: Tufin Software Technologies Ltd.  priced shares at $14 in its initial public offering Wednesday evening, setting up the Israeli cybersecurity company for a Thursday trading debut.

title: Goldman Sachs lowers chance of recession to 10%
text: Zach Guzman and Sibile Marcellus of Yahoo Finance with Kevin Kelly of Benchmark Investments discusses the U.S. economy and why Goldman Sachs lowered recession chances.

title: Q1 expectations low, will be beat: Ariel Investments vice chairman
text: CNBC's Mike Santoli and Charlie Bobrinskoy of Ariel Investments break down the trading day and the markets with the "Closing Bell" team.

title: Stocks end mostly higher after Fed minutes
text: Stocks ended mostly higher on Wednesday as investors focused on the minutes of the March Fed meeting and a policy update by the European Central Bank. The S&P 500  was up around 0.4% to end around 2,888.

title: Companies may invest less during tariff uncertainty: Expert
text: Michelle Meyer, Bank of America Merrill Lynch head of U.S. economics, and Joe Lavorgna, Natixis chief economist, join "Closing Bell" to discuss the markets and the ongoing trade talks.

title: Cybersecurity is the biggest risk for banks, says analyst
text: Jason Goldberg, Barclays analyst, joins "Power Lunch" to discuss the bank executives' testimony before the House Financial Services Committee.

title: Santelli: There isn't much to disagree with in Fed minutes
text: Steve Grasso, CNBC contributor from Stuart Frankel; and CNBC's Steve Liesman, Bob Pisani and Rick Santeli, discuss the release of the Fed minutes and signs that the Fed will keep rates the same unless the economy improves.

title: FOMC majority believe rates should remain unchanged for 2019
text: The majority of members on the Federal Open Market Committee have said they thought it was best to leave interest rates unchanged for the rest of 2019. CNBC's Steve Liesman reports.

title: Bank CEOs: Cyber threats and slowing global growth are issues
text: The CEOs of America's largest banks testify on Capitol Hill about how the industry has transformed in the 10 years following the financial crisis.

title: Big bank CEOS explain the biggest risks to the financial system
text: The CEOs of America's largest banks testify on Capitol Hill about how the industry has transformed in the 10 years following the financial crisis.

title: Uber IPO Expects Valuation Near $100 Billion, Below Prior Estimates
text: The IPO of Uber Technologies is seeking a market valuation of up to $100 billion, below the $120 billion valuation Wall Street bankers reportedly indicated they felt it was worth in October.

title: Bank CEO's pressed on Capitol Hill about CEO pay and income inequality
text:
Scott Gamm and Brian Cheung of Yahoo Finance discusses key topics being addresses at the House Financial Committee Hearing on banking.
Also, Julie Hyman, Scott Gamm and Adam Shapiro of Yahoo Finance discuss the changes in the banking industry after the financial crisis with Lending Tree Chief Economist Tendayi Kapfidze and Consumer Bankers Association CEO and President Richard Hunt.

title: Why  Action Alerts Plus Is Watching Banks, Uber and Levi's
text: Action Alerts Plus, breaks down the top headlines on Wednesday.

title: Uber plans to sell $10 billion worth of stock in IPO: Source
text: Uber is expected to kick-off the bid for its IPO tomorrow. The ride-sharing company is seeking a public market valuation of $90 to $100 billion.

title: Robinhood Launches New Premium Trading Features
text: Robinhood on Wednesday announced the rollout of several new features to its premium Robinhood Gold offering, including Level 2 market data and research from the Morningstar analyst team.

title: Vanity Fair's William Cohan on big bank CEOs testifying on Capitol Hill

title: Bank CEOs See Brexit as a Challenge, Not a Systemic Risk
text: Apr.10 -- Chief Executive Officers from seven banks discuss the extent of risks associated with Brexit and how their firms have prepared for the event. Michael Corbat of Citigroup Inc.

title: Ned Davis Research founder says 'algos' have ruined day trading
text: Ned Davis, the founder of his namesake research firm, found success as a day trader for about three decades. But now, he wouldn't even try it.

title: Lawmakers grill bank CEOs about gun industry and executive pay
text: Jessica Smith of Yahoo Finance reports on the the topics law makers are pressing bank CEOs about at the  House Financial Services Committee hearing called "Holding Megabanks Accountable."

title: Private jet company Vista Global to acquire JetSmarter, once touted as the Uber of private jets
text: Private jet company Vista Global agreed to acquire JetSmarter, betting that the value of JetSmarter's technology will outweigh the controversy and lawsuits still dogging the company.

text: The CEOs of America's largest banks testify on Capitol Hill this morning about how the industry has transformed in the 10 years following the financial crisis. Rep. Frank Lucas (R-Okla.

title: Uber Could Be Valued at $120 Billion in Year's Biggest IPO
text: Apr.10 -- The ride-hailing giant could make its offering one of the top five IPOs of all time. But Uber's road to the pubic market has not been without some speed bumps.

title: ECB Sees Interest Rates on Hold at Least Through End of 2019
text: Apr.10 -- The European Central Bank held the main refinancing and deposit facility rates steady as they see rates remaining on hold at least through the end of this year. Bloomberg's Matt Miller reports on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas.

title: Markets Must Consider a Lower-Growth World, Coronado Says
text: Apr.10 -- Julia Coronado, founder at Macropolicy Perspectives, and Julian Emanuel, chief equity and derivatives strategist at BTIG, examine what may come next for markets and the issues investors must face going forward. They speak on "Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: You need to allow big banks to fail, says banking analyst
text: The CEOs of America's largest banks will testify on Capitol Hill this morning about how the industry has transformed in the 10 years following the financial crisis. Mike Mayo, Wells Fargo Securities managing director and senior banking analyst, joins "Squawk Box" ahead of the hearing to discuss.

title: Zoom is poised to be one of the most richly valued tech companies after it goes public
text: At the top end of its pricing range, Zoom would be worth over $8 billion and investors are paying a high multiple relative to its peers.

title: Finding Golden Investment Opportunities in the Footnotes
text: My firm's analysis of footnotes is critical to finding companies where reported earnings understate economic earnings.

title: There's some complacency in the markets, two experts agree

title: US Consumer Price Index rose 0.4% in March, vs 0.3% increase expected

title: Ikea's first small-format store is opening in New York. Here's a look inside
text: Ikea's move into Manhattan comes as many retailers, like Target and Kohl's, have been experimenting with pint-size locations in urban areas.

title: The best camera phone you can’t buy in the U.S.
text: The Huawei P30 Pro is a flagship Android smartphone with a difference. It’s the first cameraphone with a new periscope zoom lens, which helps it achieve incredible zoom.

title: Uber looks to raise about $10 billion in IPO, seeks valuation of up to $100 billion--reports
text: Uber Technologies is looking to offer around $10 billion worth of stock in its initial public offering, with most of the shares being sold directly by the company, according to multiple media reports.

title: Stocks Mixed On Growth Woes; Treasury Yields Slip: Markets Wrap
text: Stocks were mixed on renewed concern about a global economic slowdown and an escalation in trade tensions. Treasuries rose and the dollar was steady.
